subclassFeature.name: Runesmith
entries: {@i Inscribe Runes to Channel Arcane Power}
A Runesmith specializes in inscribing mystical runes onto weapons and armor. The runes are enhanced to channel the Runesmith's magic, store powerful spells, and provide protection to allies.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Armor Training
entries: You gain training with Heavy armor.

entries.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item Smith's Tools|XPHB}. If you already have this proficiency, you gain proficiency with one other type of {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB} of your choice.

entries.name: Rune Crafting
entries: When you craft magic {@item Wand|XPHB|wands} or {@item Spell Scroll|XDMG|spell scrolls}, the amount of time required to craft them is halved.

subclassFeature.name: Runesmith Spells
entries: When you reach an Artificer level specified in the Runesmith Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Battle Rune
entries: Your combat training and your experiments with magic have paid off in two ways.

entries.name: Arcane Empowerment
entries: When you attack with a magic weapon, you can use your Intelligence modifier, instead of your Strength or Dexterity modifier, for the attack and damage rolls.

entries.name: Runic Weapon Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with any weapon that bears one of your {@subclassFeature Runic Inscription|Artificer|EFA|Runesmith|FFT|3|FFT|runes}. You can use a weapon bearing one of your runes as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your Artificer spells.

subclassFeature.name: Runic Inscription
entries: You gain the ability to inscribe runes, mystical symbols that store and unleash your spells through enchanted objects. The number of runes inscribed counts towards the number of items you can create with the {@classFeature Replicate Magic Item|Artificer|EFA|2|EFA} feature.

entries.name: Inscribing a Rune
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can inscribe one or more runes into weapons, pieces of armor, or objects at least the size of a rune. A rune stores one Artificer spell of 1st level or higher that you have prepared.

When inscribing the rune, you can improve it by expending additional magic item slots from your {@classFeature Replicate Magic Item|Artificer|EFA|2|EFA} feature to increase the spell's level. The spell's level can be increased by a number of levels equal to half your Artificer level (rounded down). The spell cannot exceed 5th level.

entries.name: Using Runes
entries: A rune can be activated as part of the action to cast the stored spell. You don't expend a spell slot when casting a spell this way. The spell uses your Artificer spellcasting ability for attack rolls and saving throws.
Each rune has one charge. Once the charge is used, the rune becomes inert until it is recharged.

entries.name: Recharging Runes
entries: All expended rune charges are restored when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice instead of once whenever you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Inscription
entries: Your {@subclassFeature Runic Inscription|Artificer|EFA|Runesmith|FFT|3|FFT} feature becomes more powerful. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Improved Runes
entries: Each rune now has two charges. When you reach level 15, runes gain three charges.

entries.name: Rune Replication
entries: You learn an additional plan for your {@classFeature Replicate Magic Item|Artificer|EFA|2|EFA} feature. In addition, you can create an additional item with that feature.

subclassFeature.name: Perfected Runes
entries: Your mastery of runic magic reaches its peak. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Empowered Runes
entries: When you cast a spell from a rune, you can add your Intelligence modifier to one damage roll of the spell.

entries.name: Runic Barrier
entries: As a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}, when you or a creature you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can expend a rune charge to grant the creature {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to that damage. You can use this {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Master Inscriber
entries: You have {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Half Cover} while within 10 feet of an object bearing one of your runes.

subclassFluff.name: Runesmith
entries: {@i Inscribe Ancient Power Through Mystical Runes}

A Runesmith is an Artificer that has mastered the art of inscribing ancient runes to channel magical power. These mystical symbols can protect allies, empower weapons, and ward against threats. The knowledge of these runes comes from many sourcesâ€”ancient texts, divine inspiration, or personal experimentation.
A Runesmith can be a warrior with gleaming runes across their armor, a scholar lending their power to companions through inscribed talismans, or a mystic with runes tattooed across their very body.
Runesmiths are not inherently good or evil, though their rigorous attention to detail and patience tend to make them more inclined to a Lawful perspective.
